intro: Urostachys mettenii, commonly known as the desert pincushion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is adapted to survive in poor soils and extreme temperatures. Urostachys mettenii is often found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, showcasing its resilience to drought and heat.
